stimulusHtml: A hypothetical atom with the energy levels shown in the diagram is in the ground state. Which of the following statements correctly describes whether a photon of wavelength 95nm can interact with the atom, and provides reasoning that supports the claim?
choicesHtml: The photon can be absorbed by the atom. It has more than enough energy to ionize the atom.
The photon can be absorbed by the atom. It has enough energy for the atom to make multiple transitions to different states.
The photon cannot interact with the atom. Its energy does not match any of the possible energy-level transitions.
The photon cannot interact with the atom. It has less energy than the energy needed to reach the first excited state.
